BiblioData.Title: Conductive polyolefins with good mechanical properties
BiblioData.Abstract: This invention discloses a polymeric material reinforced with single-wall nanotubes (SWNT) or multiple-wall nanotubes (MWNT) with good electrical and mechanical properties. It also discloses a process for preparing said reinforced polymeric material and their use in electrically dissipative material.

Claims.P: 1. A polymeric material reinforced with single-wall carbon nanotubes (SWNT) or multiple-wall carbon nanotubes (MWNT) and prepared by mixing in the molten state, characterized in that said carbon nanotubes, prepared by using supported catalysts, are free of support and catalyst particles and have a retained pyrolytic carbon component, said reinforced polymeric material having simultaneously improved electrical and mechanical properties.
2. The reinforced polymeric material of claim 1, wherein the polymeric material is a polyolefin.
3. The reinforced polymeric material of claim 2, wherein the polyolefin is an atactic, isotactic or syndiotactic homopolymer or copolymer of propylene.
4. The reinforced polymeric material according to any one of the preceding claims wherein the carbon nanotubes have an aspect ratio of at least 100.

5. The reinforced polymeric material according to any one of the preceding claims wherein the amount of carbon nanotubes added is of from 0.1 to 20 wt% based on the weight of the polymer and said carbon nanotubes are free of support and catalyst particles and have a retained pyrolytic carbon component
6. The reinforced polymeric material according to any one of the preceding claims that is further oriented.
7. A process for preparing the reinforced polymeric material according to claims 1 to 6 that comprises the steps of:
b) providing carbon nanotubes that are free of support and catalyst particles and have a retained pyrolytic carbon component,
c) dispersing the partly purified carbon nanotubes in the polymer matrix by mixing in the molten state,
d) optionally orienting the polymer/nanotubes mixture of step c) by stretching in the molten or in the solid state.

8. Use of carbon nanotubes, prepared by using supported catalysts, that are free of support and catalyst particles and have a retained pyrolytic carbon component to prepare reinforced polymeric material according to any one of claims 1 to 6, said polymeric material having an improved balance of electrical and mechanical properties.

9. Use of carbon nanotubes, prepared by using supported catalysts, that are free of support and catalyst particles, further purified to remove the pyrolytic carbon component to prepare reinforced polymeric material, said polymeric material having an improved balance of electrical and mechanical properties.

10. Use of carbon nanotubes, prepared by using supported catalysts, that are free of support and catalyst particles, further purified to remove the pyrolytic carbon component and then functionalised to prepare reinforced polymeric material having an improved electrical conductivity and mechanical properties.
11. Electrically dissipative material for automotive, textile or other applications prepared with the reinforced polymeric material according to any one of claims 1 to 6.
12. Shields for wires and cables prepared with the reinforced polymeric material according to any one of claims 1 to 6.
